result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keishana D Fortner in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Keishana D Fortner.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests an adjourned plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Keishana D Fortner in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has dsicovery and requests a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Keishana D Fortner in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.

Signed and filed, No Violent Contact Order. Contact with KLH to conform with any DMCPS, Family Court, and/or Juvenile Court
orders.

Defendant Keishana D Fortner in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
